most_active_tickets.title: LTM not recording any new activities/Workstream Activity not updating
[Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App and CLI on macOS: LTM/Workstream Activity Not Updating
common_issues.description: Users on macOS are experiencing issues with the Pieces desktop application and CLI where LTM and Workstream Activity are not updating or recording new activities.  Issues range from complete stoppage after a short period to failures generating summaries with 404 errors.  One user reported an inability to open the Pieces Copilot service with an 'Application not found' error. Troubleshooting steps may include checking application installation, restarting the app, and verifying Pieces OS version compatibility.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS integration failures across platforms
common_issues.description: Users on Linux, macOS, and Windows report PiecesOS integration issues with desktop apps and CLI. Problems include broken workstream summaries, failure to detect Ollama on Linux, CLI model validation errors on macOS, and missing PiecesOS directories on Windows. Suggested solutions include verifying Ollama installation/path, checking PiecesOS version and logs, and reinstalling PiecesOS/related apps.

related_issues.title: [Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
related_issues.text:
[Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Describe the bug**  
1. No new workstream summaries have been generated since mid‑July 2025. Manual roll‑up always fails with “unable to find any workstream events.”  
2. Pieces Desktop reports “Ollama needs to be installed” even though `ollama` is in `$PATH` and the service is running on `127.0.0.1:11434`.

---

**To Reproduce**  
1. **Environment**  
   - OS: Linux Mint 22.1 “Cinnamon” (X11) (64‑bit)  
   - Kernel: 6.8.0‑62‑generic
   - PiecesOS v12.1.0 (snap)
   - Pieces Desktop: v4.3.1
   - Ollama CLI: `/usr/local/bin/ollama` (installed via official script)  
   - Ollama service: running (`ollama serve` → `Error: bind: address already in use`; confirmed via browser at http://127.0.0.1:11434)

2. **Workstream summary failure**  
   - Open Pieces Desktop → Workstream Activity  
   - Observe events up through July 9, 2025, but no events or summaries for July 10–13.  
   - Click “Generate manual Workstream Rollup” for any time window → error:  
     ```
     unable to find any workstream events
     ```

3. **Ollama detection failure**  
   - Verify in terminal:  
     ```bash
     which ollama
     → /usr/local/bin/ollama

     ollama list
     → (lists available models)

     curl http://127.0.0.1:11434
     → “Ollama is running”
     ```  
   - In Pieces Desktop, attempt to enable “Local Models” → receives error “Ollama needs to be installed.”

---

**Expected behavior**  
- Workstream summaries continue to be generated daily (or allow manual roll‑ups to succeed).  
- Pieces Desktop auto‑detects my installed Ollama CLI + service and lists local models.

---

**Screenshots & Logs**  
- **Pieces log directory**: `~/.local/share/com.pieces.os.dependency_management/` shows logs only up to July 9.
- **No error messages** appear in those dependency logs.  

---

**Additional context**  
- I’ve already:  
  - Verified `snap refresh` and `apt update && apt upgrade` to ensure latest PiecesOS and Desktop.  
  - Stopped/restarted any existing Ollama service (killed port 11434, rebooted, then `ollama serve`).  
  - Manually pointed Pieces Desktop at `/usr/local/bin/ollama` and `http://127.0.0.1:11434` in settings, then fully quit & relaunched the app.  
- Issue has persisted for >1 week.

Please let me know what additional details I can provide to help debug. Thank you!

related_issues.title: com.pieces.os does not exist
related_issues.text:
com.pieces.os does not exist
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS: 12.1.0 Pieces for Developers: 4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed UltraEdit on my Windows 11 computer (ARM), running Windows Home. After installing, creating an account, etc. I started UltraEdit and was looking forward to the integration. What I was met with was a window that said that Pieces isn't running with an error unable to determine Pieces connection port. After some discussion, UltraEdit team said that I was likely missing the file %USERPROFILE%\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Config\.port.txt
Turns out I'm missing the directory com.pieces.os. I has not been created. I uninstalled all the Pieces apps and reinstalled from the website, hoping that this directory would be created. Now UltraEdit says Pieces for Developers is not installed and prompts me to Download Pieces. Clicking that link takes me directly to the page I just downloaded from.
I suggested to UltraEdit support that I could recreate the directory structure and add .port.txt, but they said instead that I should contact you. While you are looking at this, I am going to do a complete uninstall of UltraEdit and Pieces components, deleting any registry keys I can find (as uninstall doesn't remove any), and remove the .pieces_identites folder from Documents, then do a complete reinstall.
Looking forward to a solution to this.
Regards,
Ian Hannah

common_issues.title: Users unable to sign in across multiple Pieces platforms
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues signing in to Pieces OS on Desktop Application, VS Code, and CLI.  Error messages vary, but all prevent successful login.  This affects Windows and macOS users on Pieces OS versions 4.3.1 and 12.1.0. Further investigation needed to determine root cause and solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Integrations: Errors and Access Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various errors across different Pieces integrations (CLI, VS Code) and with the Pieces OS itself.  These include validation errors, application not found errors, and sign-in issues.  Common causes might be related to model access, application paths, or account authentication problems.  Suggested solutions include verifying model versions, checking installation paths, and ensuring correct login credentials.

common_issues.title: Auto-Generated Context Resets to Medium
common_issues.description: Users report that the Auto-Generated Context setting in the Pieces desktop app repeatedly reverts to "Medium" even after being manually set to "High". This occurs across different macOS versions and Pieces builds.  The issue persists after app and OS updates. Users are unsure if the "High" setting ever takes effect.

related_issues.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
related_issues.text:
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Platform MacOS Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello!

This is an issue that I've seen happen in all of the builds since I've started using pieces. When changing the Auto-Generated Context (Saved Material Enrichment) option in Machine Learning from the menu, in my case I want it to be "High", but every time I change it, when I check the next day or any time later, or every time the app or os updates, the option selected goes back to "Medium". So I don't actually even know if it ever used "High", because it always returns the option to "Medium".

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the 'Pieces Desktop App and CLI on macOS: LTM/Workstream Activity Not Updating' issue, given its high frequency and activity level.
Investigate the 'PiecesOS integration failures across platforms' as it impacts multiple operating systems and core functionalities.
Address the sign-in issues affecting multiple Pieces platforms to ensure user access.
Look into the 'Auto-Generated Context Resets to Medium' problem to improve user experience.
Review and update documentation or onboarding materials related to Ollama installation and configuration on Linux.
Check for potential conflicts between Pieces OS, Desktop Application, and third-party integrations like UltraEdit.
Improve error messaging and guidance for users experiencing sign-in and application launch failures.
Consider adding troubleshooting steps for common issues to the Pieces support knowledge base.
